rules: Rule1: If the employee is late, then the employee is absent.
Rule2: Either the employee is late or the employee is sick.
Rule3: In the event that the employee is sick, the employee is not fired.
Rule4: Should the employee be absent, then the employee is not fired.
Rule5: If the employee is remote, then the employee is not present.
Rule6: The employee is remote or the employee is on vacation.
Rule7: Provided that the employee is on vacation, the employee is on leave.
Rule8: If the employee is available, then the employee is not assigned to a project.
Rule9: In the event that the employee is efficient, the employee is not terminated.
Rule10: If the employee has taken a course, then either the employee is certified or, provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is trained.
Rule11: The employee has taken a course or the employee has attended a workshop.
Rule12: Should the employee have attended a workshop, then either the employee is certified or, if management does not approve the employee, the employee is trained.
Rule13: If the employee is skilled, then the employee is qualified.
Rule14: In the event that the employee is experienced, the project is completed.
Rule15: Should the employee be qualified, then the employee is experienced.
Rule16: Either the employee has attended a meeting or the employee is not distracted.
Rule17: Provided that the employee is prepared, then the employee has not attended a meeting.
Rule18: If the employee has reviewed materials, then the employee is prepared.
Rule19: Whenever the employee has studied, the employee is prepared.
Rule20: In the event that the employee has researched, the employee has reviewed materials.
Rule21: The employee has researched or the employee has practiced.
Rule22: Should the employee have practiced, then the employee has studied.
Rule23: If the employee is eligible, then, provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is promoted.
Rule24: Whenever the employee meets requirements, the employee is eligible.
Rule25: Provided that the employee is qualified for promotion, then the employee meets requirements.
Rule26: In the event that the employee has resigned, the employee has left the company.
Rule27: Either the employee has resigned or the employee has retired.
Rule28: Provided that the employee has retired, the employee is not replaced.
Rule29: If the employee has left the company, then the employee is not replaced.
Rule30: Whenever the employee is competent, the employee is trained.
Rule31: Either the employee is a certified professional or, if management does not approve the employee, then the employee is competent.
Rule32: In the event that the employee is uncertified, the employee is not a certified professional.
Rule33: Should the employee be focused, then the employee is not distracted.
Rule34: Provided that the employee is motivated, the employee is not distracted.
Rule35: If the employee is productive, then either the employee is focused or the employee is motivated.
Rule36: If it is not the case that the employee being deserving implies the employee is promoted, then the employee is fired.
Rule37: Should it not be the case that the employee being on vacation implies the employee is not present, then the employee is terminated.
Rule38: In the event that it is not the case that the employee being on leave implies the employee is not present, then the employee is replaced.
Rule39: Provided that it is not the case that the employee not being available implies the project is completed, then the project deadline is met.
Rule40: If it is not the case that the employee not being available implies the project is completed, then the project deadline is not met.
Rule41: Whenever it is not the case that management not approving the employee implies the employee is not working, then the employee is distracted.
Rule42: In the event that the employee is not available, the employee is skilled.
Rule43: Provided that management does not approve the employee, the employee is assigned to a project.
Rule44: Whenever management does not approve the employee, the employee is deserving.
Rule45: In the event that management does not approve the employee, the employee is present.
Rule46: If management does not approve the employee, then the employee is working.
Rule47: Whenever management does not approve the employee, the employee is not trained.
facts: Fact2: The employee is qualified for promotion.
Fact5: The employee is not promoted.
Fact6: The employee is not certified.
Fact7: The project is not completed.
